benchmark_details.name: ReasonBench
benchmark_details.overview: ReasonBench is the first evaluation benchmark focused on structured graphic reasoning tasks, which includes 1,613 questions from real-world intelligence tests. It evaluates VLMs' performance in complex graphic reasoning, covering dimensions related to location, attribute, quantity, and multi-element tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of ReasonBench is to evaluate visual language models' (VLMs) capabilities in structured graphic reasoning tasks, identifying limitations and improving their performance.

data.source: The dataset consists of 1,613 standardized test problems gathered from various human intelligence tests such as Chinese Civil Service Aptitude Tests, Mensa Tests, and Ravenâ€™s Progressive Matrices.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation based on a triple-controlled evaluation protocol ensuring measurement reliability and cross-model comparability.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on comparison to human-level performance and existing models.
methodology.baseline_results: Human participants achieve an average accuracy of 68.7% on the test set.
methodology.validation: Standardized evaluation protocol based on Pass@1 single-attempt scoring.
